intro: Amsinckia brachycalyx, commonly known as the short-calyx velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue to purple in color. Its leaves are alternate and often have a velvety texture, contributing to its common name. Amsinckia brachycalyx is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and dry landscapes.
